metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22738 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Applying a CSS filter effect could have accessed out of bounds memory. This could have lead to a heap-buffer-overflow causing a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 91.5, Firefox < 96, and Thunderbird < 91.5.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22738` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 96.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required
